titleStmt.title: Letter : from Joseph to Pisentius, Bishop of Coptos
titleStmt.author: Joseph, 7th cent. A.D.

msContents.summary: Joseph addresses Apa Pisentius, probably Bishop of Coptos (569-632 A.D.), who fled from Coptos to western Thebes during the Sassanian invasion of Egypt in the early 7th century.

msItemStruct.note: Margins: recto top, 1 cm.; verso bottom, 2.7 cm.

Bishop Pisentius' extensive correspondence (only letters addressed to him) circulated on the antiquities market in the 19th century and are mainly held by the Louvre (see Revillout, Eugene. "Textes coptes: Extraits de la correspondence de St. Pesunthius, eveque de Coptos, et de plusiers documents analogues (juridiques ou economiques)." Revue Egyptologique 9 (1900) p. 133-177; 10 (1902) p. 34-47; 14 (1914) p. 22-32.
Bancroft Library, Univ. of Calif., Berkeley

layout.ab: 5 lines on recto along the fibers; 3 lines on verso across the fibers

div.ab: I greet your lordship, Holy Father, I salute [you, that] you may forgive me because I have dared to ...." After a break in the papyrus removes the description of the of his offense, Joseph continues to ask forgiveness, referring to the Bishop's charity.
